result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth George Scharp Jr.

records.addlTxt: Email sent to ACJ advising def has court on Nov 7;  ka

HAS $2000 POSTED ALREADY
COVERS CASES 21CM146, 22CM14, 22CF131, and 22CF58.
Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there. 
Def to have NO Contact w/ J.M.F. or residence not to be within one city block or place that J.M.F. is at.

Warrants in each case quashed.  FF of bond is vacated.  Government road address correct.  State comments on bail/bond.  Atty comments on bail/bond.  Def does qualify for PD services.  Atty represents def in some cases, looking for Atty in case 22CF131.  Court orders $4000 cash already has $2000 posted.  NON-monetary conditions remain in place.  Bond covers all cases.  AIA in 22CF131 Stc in other cases.  If def is at liberty he needs to appear in person.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Cases 21CM146, 22CF58, 22CF131. and 22CM14.  22CF58 here for prelim hearing, 22CF131 hear for 131 Atty not appointed in this case.

State filed information now, emailed copy to Atty contains same counts.  Atty asking for arraignment at a later date.  Remaining cases to track.  
22CF131, def contacted the PD office, does qualify, Atty has a conflict with case.  Waiting for an attorney to be appointed. in this case.
